item.title: DBMS
item.description: Database Management System is a software that controls a database. DBMS’s fall into two camps: Relational or Non-Relational. A relational database, stores information in tables and often the tables have shared information between them, they use columns to specify and define the data being stored and rows to actually store the data.

item.title: MySQL Cheatsheet
item.description: SQL (Structured Query Language) is a feature-rich language used for querying databases. These queries are better referred to as statements.
